title: Toggle switch
summary: A toggle switch allows users to turn a setting on or off.

ux-text.title: Writing UX text for toggle switch
ux-text.section-content:
### Be clear about what on and off mean

The labels or nearby text should make the toggle’s purpose clear. Users should instantly understand what happens when it’s turned on or off – don’t be vague. Write labels that describe the active state, not the action, and avoid negatives as they can cause confusion.

**Do – labels that describe the active state:**

_Notifications_ – On/Off

_Dark mode_ – On/Off

**Don't – describe the action, be too vague or use negatives:**

_Turn on notification_ or _Turn on dark mode –_ On/Off

_Enable_ – On/Off (too vague, enable what?)

Disable _–_ On/Off

Don’t show _–_ On/Off

dolist.text: Do – labels that describe the active state:  Notifications – On/Off  Dark mode – On/Off

dontlist.text: Don't – describe the action, be too vague or use negatives:  Turn on notification or Turn on dark mode – On/Off  Enable – On/Off (too vague, enable what?)  Disable – On/Off  Don’t show – On/Off

ux-text.title: Keep labels short
ux-text.section-content:
One or two words is ideal.

**Do:** _Wi-Fi_, _Location_, _Auto-update_  
**Don’t:** _Automatically download updates in the background_

ux-text.title: Provide context where needed
ux-text.section-content:
Add a short description if the toggle affects something non-obvious.

**Example:**  
Auto-renew – On/Off  
_Your subscription will renew every month._
